nav.makeAfkWindowRunning: Make sure you have both an AFK and window watcher running

home.title: Home
home.androidNote: ActivityWatch on Android is in a very early stage of development. There will be bugs, but we hope you bear with us as we refine things and get it on par with the desktop version of ActivityWatch (which you should try!).
home.earlyDaysMessage: It's still early days for ActivityWatch. We've come a long way but we need users (like you!) to provide feedback and help us turn ActivityWatch into a successful project. Early users like you mean a lot to us, and we hope you'll reach out to us with any ideas you have for improvements!
home.developerMessage: If you are a developer, we hope you can contribute by writing a watcher, visualization, or something else, and share it with us on the forum!
home.surveyMessage: If you have a minute to spare, please take the time to fill out our {surveyLink} or {forumLink}.
home.voteOnFeatures: vote on features on the forum
home.spreadMessage: Nothing is as motivating as getting ActivityWatch into the hands of users. By sharing it you get us to make ActivityWatch even better!
home.alternativeTo: Give us a like and a review on {link}
home.socialMedia: Follow us and spread the word on {twitterLink} and {facebookLink}
home.supportMessage: Do you like ActivityWatch? Has it helped you? Help us help you by donating! You can donate to us via:
home.donationPageInfo: For more info, please visit the {link}.
home.workingOn: Want to know what we're working on?
home.landingPageHint: You can change which page opens when you open ActivityWatch (instead of this page) in the {settingsLink}.

settings.title: Settings
settings.themeDescription: Choose the color theme for the interface
settings.themeColorNote: Change color theme of the application (you need to change categories colors manually to be suitable with dark mode).
settings.dayStartDescription: The time at which days "start", since humans don't always go to bed before midnight. Set to 04:00 by default.
settings.startOfWeekDescription: The weekday which starts a new week.
settings.landingPageDescription: The page to open when opening ActivityWatch, or clicking the logo in the top menu.
settings.timelineDurationDescription: The default duration used for 'show last' in the timeline view.
settings.releaseNotificationsDescription: We will send you a notification if there is a new release available for download, this check will happen at most once per day.
settings.colorSettingsDescription: Uses the old coloring style for some visualizations when uncategorized or no category color.
settings.activePatternDescription: Apps or titles matching this regular expression will never be counted as AFK. Can be used to count time as active, despite no input (like meetings, or games with controllers). An empty string disables it.
settings.categorizationDescription: Rules for categorizing events. An event can only have one category. If several categories match, the deepest one will be chosen.
settings.categoryBuilderDescription: You can use the Category Builder to quickly create categories from uncategorized activity.
settings.categoryPresets: You can also find and share categorization rule presets on the forum.
settings.categoryDocs: For help on how to write categorization rules, see the documentation.
settings.confirmLeave: Your categories have unsaved changes, are you sure you want to leave?
settings.developerNote: Note: These settings are meant for developers who (hopefully) know what they are doing, and as such, may break things unexpectedly.
settings.devModeDescription: Devmode enables some features that are still work-in-progress.
settings.showYearlyDescription: Querying an entire year is a very heavy operation, and is likely to lead to timeouts. However, the query might be fast enough if you're running aw-server-rust.
settings.useMultideviceDescription: Multidevice query is where events are collected from several hosts in the Activity view. It is an early experiment, that currently does not support browser buckets (or the audible-as-active feature).
settings.requestTimeoutDescription: The maximum amount of time a server request can take before timing out. Setting this to a high value can be useful for large queries. Note that you need to reload the web UI for it to apply.

activity.title: Activity
activity.excludeAFKTooltip: Filter away time where the AFK watcher didn't detect any input.
activity.countAudibleAsActive: Count audible browser tab as active
activity.countAudibleTooltip: If the active window is an audible browser tab, count as active. Requires a browser watcher.
activity.includeStopwatchNote: Note: WIP. Stopwatch events shadow other events, when overlapping with them. Only shown in devmode.

timeline.title: Timeline
timeline.noMatchingEvents: No events match selected criteria. Timeline is not updated.
timeline.dragToPan: Drag to pan and scroll to zoom

stopwatch.title: Stopwatch
stopwatch.earlyExperiment: This is an early experiment. Data entered here is not shown in the Activity view, yet.

buckets.title: Buckets
buckets.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete bucket "{bucketId}"?
buckets.confirmDeletePermanent: This is permanent and cannot be undone!
buckets.importBucketsDescription: A valid file to import is a JSON file from either an export of a single bucket or an export from multiple buckets. If there are buckets with the same name the import will fail.
buckets.importFailed: Import failed, see aw-server logs for more info
buckets.moreWatchers: Are you looking to collect more data? Check out the docs for more watchers.
buckets.deviceSpecial: Device is a special device, unattributed to a hostname, or not assigned a device ID.
buckets.moreWatchersHint: Are you looking to collect more data? Check out {link} for more watchers.
buckets.chooseOrDropFile: Choose or drop a file here...

query.title: Query Explorer
query.seeDocumentation: See the documentation for help on how to write queries.

search.earlyDevelopment: This feature is still in early development.
search.didntFind: Didn't find what you were looking for?
search.addWeek: Add a week to the search:

graph.description: Displays a graph of categories and their transitions.
graph.earlyDevelopment: This feature is still in early development.
graph.prInfo: This feature is still in early development. See PR {link} for more information.
graph.didntFind: Didn't find what you were looking for?

report.title: Report
report.description: Generate a report of time spent on a certain category of device activity.
report.earlyDevelopment: This feature is still in early development.
report.tooManyEvents: Too many events, will only show last 500 events.
report.didntFind: Didn't find what you were looking for?
report.addWeek: Add a week to the search:

trends.title: Trends
trends.earlyDevelopment: This feature is still in early development.

categoryBuilder.title: Categorization helper
categoryBuilder.description1: This tool will help you create categories from your uncategorized time.
categoryBuilder.description2: It works by fetching all uncategorized time for a recent timeperiod, and then finds the most common words (by time, not count) each of which may then either be ignored (if too broad/irrelevant), or used to create a new (sub)category, or to append the word to a pre-existing category rule. Words with less than 60s of time will not be shown.
categoryBuilder.description3: When you're done, you can inspect the categories in the {settingsLink} page.
categoryBuilder.noWords: No words with significant duration. You're good to go!

bucketTools.mergeDescription: Sometimes, you might want to merge the events of two buckets together into one. This is commonly useful to address the case where your hostname might have changed, creating two buckets for the same watcher and host, which you want to combine together again.
bucketTools.bucketFromDescription: Select the bucket from which you want to merge the events. This bucket will be deleted after the merge.
bucketTools.bucketToDescription: Select the bucket to which you want to merge the events. This bucket will remain after the merge.
bucketTools.validateDescription: This is a small tool to check the validity of your buckets and their events.
bucketTools.overlapsSameData: Of these, {duration} are overlaps where the data is the same. These events could potentially be merged.
bucketTools.zeroDurationFound: The following {count} zero-duration events were found:

poll.title: User Satisfaction Poll
poll.question: How satisfied are you with ActivityWatch?
poll.questionLong: Hey there! You've been using ActivityWatch for a while. How likely are you to recommend it to a friend/colleague on a scale 1-10? (with 10 being the most likely)
poll.positiveIntro: We're happy to hear you enjoy using ActivityWatch, but we can do better!
poll.positiveHelp: To help us help you, here are a few things you can do:
poll.postSocialMedia: Post about it on social media, we are on
poll.negativeIntro: We are sorry to hear that you did not like ActivityWatch, but we want to improve! We would be very thankful if you helped us by:
poll.voteFeatures: Vote for new features on the

notFound.title: Woops, this page was not found!
notFound.message: The page you are looking for does not exist.
notFound.tryNavigating: Try navigating back where you came from.

dev.title: Developer zone
dev.description: Just some tools to aid in development and debugging.
dev.nothing: Nothing to see here right now...

devOnly.message: This will not appear in the production build

uncategorized.description: You have a significant amount of uncategorized time. Consider creating categories to better track your activities.
uncategorized.youHaveTotal: You have a total of {duration} uncategorized time, that's {percentage}% of all time today.
uncategorized.addressWith: You can address this by using the

topBucketData.selectWatcher: Select a watcher to load events for this period.
topBucketData.noEventsFound: No events found for this watcher and time range.
topBucketData.pickField: Pick a field to see results.

notifications.newRelease: A new release, v{version}, is available for download, you can also disable future reminders and checks for updates.
notifications.disabledCheck: Checking for new releases is now disabled, you can re-enable it in the settings page.

errors.connectionFailed: Failed to connect to ActivityWatch server
errors.importOnlyJSON: Only JSON files are possible to import
errors.categoriesNotDefined: __CATEGORIES__ was used in query but no categories have been defined yet.
